title: Problem Overview
content:
**Erdős Problem #570: Cycle-Graph Ramsey Numbers**

For k ≥ 3 and H with m edges (no isolated vertices):
R(C_k, H) ≤ 2m + ⌈(k-1)/2⌉

**Status:** SOLVED (1993-2024)

**Key contributors:** EFRS, Sidorenko, Jayawardene, Cambie et al.
mathContext: R(G, H) is the minimum n such that any 2-coloring of K_n contains either G or H as a monochromatic subgraph.

title: Cycle Graph
content:
**CycleGraph k:** The cycle C_k on k vertices (k ≥ 3).

Adjacency: vertices i and j are adjacent iff |i - j| ≡ 1 (mod k).

This is the graph the 'red' player tries to avoid in the Ramsey game.

title: Edge Count
content:
**edgeCount G:** Number of edges in graph G.

This is the parameter m in the conjecture. The upper bound is linear in m.

title: Isolated Vertices
content:
**IsIsolated G v:** Vertex v has no neighbors.

**NoIsolatedVertices G:** Every vertex has at least one neighbor.

The conjecture requires H to have no isolated vertices. This ensures m ≥ |V(H)|/2.

title: Ramsey Number
content:
**RamseyNumber G H:** The minimum n such that any 2-coloring of K_n contains either a red G or blue H.

This is the central object of study. The conjecture bounds R(C_k, H) in terms of k and |E(H)|.
mathContext: Ramsey's theorem guarantees R(G, H) exists and is finite for any G, H.

title: Upper Bound Function
content:
**UpperBound k m:** 2m + ⌈(k-1)/2⌉

This is the conjectured upper bound. It's linear in m (the edge count) with an additive term depending only on k.

title: Main Conjecture
content:
**Erdos570Conjecture:**

∀ k ≥ 3, ∀ H with m edges and no isolated vertices:
R(C_k, H) ≤ 2m + ⌈(k-1)/2⌉

This is the main statement to be proved.

title: EFRS 1993 (Even k)
content:
**efrs_1993_even:**

The conjecture holds for all even k ≥ 4.

Erdős-Faudree-Rousseau-Schelp proved this in 'Ramsey size linear graphs' (1993).
mathContext: Even cycles have special structure that simplifies the extremal analysis.

title: Sidorenko 1993 (k=3)
content:
**sidorenko_1993_triangle:**

For k = 3 (triangles), R(C_3, H) ≤ 2m + 1.

Sidorenko proved this in 'The Ramsey number of an n-edge graph versus triangle' (1993).

title: Jayawardene 1999 (k=5)
content:
**jayawardene_1999_pentagon:**

For k = 5 (pentagons), R(C_5, H) ≤ 2m + 2.

Jayawardene extended the result to the pentagon case in 1999.

title: CFMPP 2024 (Odd k≥7)
content:
**cfmpp_2024_odd:**

For all odd k ≥ 7, R(C_k, H) ≤ 2m + ⌈(k-1)/2⌉.

Cambie-Freschi-Morawski-Petrova-Pokrovskiy completed the proof in 2024, resolving the final cases.
mathContext: This recent result closed a 30-year gap in the theory.

title: Complete Resolution
content:
**erdos_570_resolved:** Erdos570Conjecture

The conjecture holds for ALL k ≥ 3 by combining:
- Even k: EFRS 1993
- k = 3: Sidorenko 1993
- k = 5: Jayawardene 1999
- Odd k ≥ 7: CFMPP 2024

title: Examples
content:
**Concrete examples:**

- R(C_3, K_3) = 6: bound = 2·3 + 1 = 7 ≥ 6 ✓
- R(C_4, P_3) ≤ 6: bound = 2·2 + 2 = 6

The bound is verified for classical cases.

title: Summary Theorem
content:
**erdos_570_summary:**

Combines the main conjecture with all individual case proofs.

**Timeline:**
- 1993: Even k and k=3
- 1999: k=5
- 2024: Odd k≥7

**Status:** FULLY RESOLVED
